roleset.name: mathematics, mathematical dividing
roleset.note: DIVIDE-V NOTES: Based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison with math sense of 'add'.Member of VNcls multiply-108-1. (from divide.01-v)

role.descr: resulting quantity, answer to math problem

example.name: made up
example.text: John divided 16 by 4 and arrived at an answer of 3.

example.name: All args
example.text: In Part A you just divided the mass by the volume to get density.

example.name: nominal math
example.text: What results from the dividing of 4 by 2?.

roleset.name: separate, separated; suffering disunity, causing separation
roleset.note: DIVIDE-V NOTES: Based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls separate-23.1-1, other_cos-45.4. (from divide.02-v)
DIVIDED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data. Corresponds to VNcls separate-23.1-1, other_cos-45.4. (from divided.01-j)
DIVISION-N NOTES: Corresponds with divide.02. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from division.01-n)
DIVISIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, divide-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls VNcls separate-23.1-1, other_cos-45.4. (from divisive.01-j)

roles.note: Arg0 differs from the verb frame in that it is more likely to be a subject matter/cause than agent. Arg3 not present in the verb frame. (from divided.01-j) Arg2 from divide-v.02 and Arg3 from divided-j.01 not expected to occur, and have been omitted. (from divisive.01-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: As part of its reorganization this week, Western Digital has divided its business into two segments -- storage products, including controllers and disk drives; and microcomputer products, which include graphics, communications and peripheral control chips.
example.arg: As part of its reorganization this week
into two segments -- storage products, including controllers and disk drives; and microcomputer products, which include graphics, communications and peripheral control chips

example.name: passivized
example.text: [The group]-1 is divided *trace*-1 primarily between software, semiconductors and computers.

example.name: active, no arg2
example.text: [Herbert M. Baum, the 53-year-old president of the company's Campbell U.S.A. unit, and Edwin L. Harper, 47, the chief financial officer,]-1 will run Campbell as a team, *trace*-1 dividing responsibilities rather evenly until a successor is named.

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: The House and Senate are divided over whether the United Nations Population Fund will receive any portion of these appropriations , but the size of the increase is itself significant .
example.arg: over whether the United Nations Population Fund will receive any portion of these appropriations

example.text: Loyalties are divided between teachers and patient

example.name: All Args
example.text: Fluffy's division of the sheep into white sheep and black sheep was executed flawlessly, and she won the sheepherding competition.
example.arg: into white sheep and black sheep

example.name: just arg0, typical
example.text: Australians voted against becoming a republic in a 1999 referendum , but [the issue]-1 continues [*-1]to be divisive .

example.name: both args
example.text: Such sexual tension was divisive of the civil rights movement;

role.descr: smaller units arg 1 is divided into/among

example.name: Passive
example.text: * Remember that most modern people live long lives that-1 can be divided *-1 up into many stages.
